errorTitle: This image is missing an accessible name
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.1.1 Non-text Content
resultTitle: Provide a text alternative for all non-text content
errorDescription: All images must have a text alternative. If you do not supply a text alternative, that will mean that users who cannot see the image will not understand what the image conveys.

errorTitle: These list items have no parent element.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
resultTitle: Use list markup (such as `ol`, `ul`, and `dl`) for lists and any sub-lists and ensure list markup is appropriate for the content being conveyed
errorDescription: These list items do not have a proper list container. As a consequence, assistive technologies are likely to be unable to accurately determing what type of list this is and/ or how many things are in the list.
errorSnippet: • Xem thêm

errorTitle: The layout or sizing of this page causes horizontal scrolling.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 1.4.8 Visual Presentation
resultTitle: Avoid layouts that result in horizontal scroll
errorDescription: This page is too wide, and it causes horizontal scrolling (at the tested viewport size). This probably means that the page is not responsively designed. Horizontal scrolling will cause difficulties for users with low vision, especially if they have their monitor set to a low resolution.

errorTitle: This link uses an invalid hypertext reference.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value
resultTitle: Use the `a` element for links, and make sure that each link has a valid `href` attribute
errorDescription: This link's `href` attribute is not properly constructed. Links structured like this one often suggest that they are  being used as a custom control for something other than navigation.
errorSnippet: Tiếng Việt

errorTitle: This link uses an invalid hypertext reference.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value
resultTitle: Use the `a` element for links, and make sure that each link has a valid `href` attribute
errorDescription: This link's `href` attribute is not properly constructed. Links structured like this one often suggest that they are  being used as a custom control for something other than navigation.
errorSnippet: Đăng nhập

errorTitle: This list container is nested immediately within another list container.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
resultTitle: Use list markup (such as `ol`, `ul`, and `dl`) for lists and any sub-lists and ensure list markup is appropriate for the content being conveyed
errorDescription: The semantic structure of lists only allows sub-lists to begin as part of an existing item in the parent list.  This one is not nested properly. Although it might display properly in a browser, it will not be conveyed accurately to an assistive technology, causing confusion for the user
errorSnippet:
• Tại TP. Hà Nội:
    • 45 Phố Vọng - Hai Bà Trưng - Hà Nội; ĐT: (024)

errorTitle: This link has no text inside it.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context),Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 2.4.9 Link Purpose (Link Only)
resultTitle: Make sure that link text (and the alternate text for any images that are used as links) describes the destination or purpose of the link.
errorDescription: This link has no text in it. Because accessibility APIs use a link's text to determine its accessible name, this link will not have an accessible name, and it will not be announced correctly by assistive technologies.

errorTitle: This `id` is being used more than once.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 4.1.1 Parsing
resultTitle: Don't use an `id` more than once within a page.
errorDescription: This `id` attribute value is being used more than once. If this `id` is being used to reference a UI control, that can cause issues for users with assistive technologies.
errorSnippet: Yêu cầu kích hoạt

errorTitle: This `id` is being used more than once.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 4.1.1 Parsing
resultTitle: Don't use an `id` more than once within a page.
errorDescription: This `id` attribute value is being used more than once. If this `id` is being used to reference a UI control, that can cause issues for users with assistive technologies.

errorTitle: List item has no useful text.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
resultTitle: Use list markup (such as `ol`, `ul`, and `dl`) for lists and any sub-lists and ensure list markup is appropriate for the content being conveyed
errorDescription: This `li` element does not appear to contain useful content. Chances are, it is being used to hold decorative text.

errorTitle: Links have identical `href` attribute values but different text.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context),Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 2.4.9 Link Purpose (Link Only)
resultTitle: Avoid using different link text for links that point to the same destination
errorDescription: The path for this link (its `href` attribute) is the same as another link on this page. However, the text in those links differ from one another. This may cause confusion because it isn't clear what makes these two destinations different from another.
errorSnippet: Đăng nhập

errorTitle: Links have identical `href` attribute values but different text.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context),Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 2.4.9 Link Purpose (Link Only)
resultTitle: Avoid using different link text for links that point to the same destination
errorDescription: The path for this link (its `href` attribute) is the same as another link on this page. However, the text in those links differ from one another. This may cause confusion because it isn't clear what makes these two destinations different from another.

errorTitle: Alt-text consists only of non-alphanumerics.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.1.1 Non-text Content
resultTitle: Make sure that each image has alternate text is clear and informative.
errorDescription: The `alt` attribute for this image consists solely of non-alphanumeric characters, such as punctuation marks. It is unlikely that this `alt` attribute is a true alternative for the image.

errorTitle: Insufficient line height.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 1.4.8 Visual Presentation
resultTitle: Set a `line-height` (leading) that is at least one and a half times the current font size.
errorDescription: This content's `line-height` is too short. Increasing the `line-height` to 150%, or a space-and-a-half will improve readability for all users, but especially those with dyslexia.

errorTitle: Actionable element smaller than minimum size.

standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships,Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA: 1.4.5 Images of Text,Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA: 3.2.4 Consistent Identification,Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA: 1.4.4 Resize text,Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 2.5.5 Target Size
resultTitle: Ensure content is legible.

errorTitle: Headings not structured in a hierarchical manner.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships,Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 2.4.10 Section Headings
resultTitle: Make sure that headings are in the right order for the content.
errorDescription: The heading structure of this page does not effectively communicate the structure of the content on it. Heading elements provide a number of important benefits to users. They can be useful as wayfinding cues for in-page navigation, they can contribute to a summary of the page, and they can provide context to the content below them. To effectively do so, the headings should not needlessly skip levels.

errorTitle: Provide a means to skip past repetitive navigation links.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks
resultTitle: Give users a way to skip past repetitive navigation links  and make sure the location is relevant
errorDescription: Without a way to easily bypass large sections of repetitive conent (page navigation, sidebars, etc.), navigating using text-to-speech software becomes a tedious and time-consuming task. A skip link placed high up in the document source order allows a user to quickly bypass the repetitive content and jump to the page's main content area.

errorTitle: Adjacent links going to the same destination.
standards: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level A: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context),Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AAA: 2.4.9 Link Purpose (Link Only)
resultTitle: Avoid using different link text for links that point to the same destination
errorDescription: This link goes to the same place as the link next to it. This adds an unnecessary tab stop and unnecessary verbosity for screen reader users.
